intro: Rhigozum trichotomum, commonly known as the three-branched sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, mat-forming shrub that produces small, white or pale green flowers. The plant has succulent, hairy leaves that help it retain moisture in dry environments. Its root system is extensive and adapted to stabilize sand dunes. Rhigozum trichotomum plays an important ecological role in preventing soil erosion in its native habitat.
